intro: Pneumonanthe newberryi var. tiogana, commonly known as the Tiogana bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The flowers are white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
